subject: Add ironic endpoint filter options
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-25 02:47:42.000000000', 'message': 'Add ironic endpoint filter options

This change introduces the following two options to look up the proper
Ironic API endpoint for notification.

1. region_name
This determines the Ironic region to use, and is useful(or required)
if Keystone manages multiple regions.

2. interface
This determines the endpoint type to use. This is useful for example
when using internal API endpoint for communications among services.

Change-Id: If696c23ad5e41c101b1d70c0bd958e9abd05b5be
'}]
commit_message:
Add ironic endpoint filter options

This change introduces the following two options to look up the proper
Ironic API endpoint for notification.

1. region_name
This determines the Ironic region to use, and is useful(or required)
if Keystone manages multiple regions.

2. interface
This determines the endpoint type to use. This is useful for example
when using internal API endpoint for communications among services.

Change-Id: If696c23ad5e41c101b1d70c0bd958e9abd05b5be

commit_message:
fix 'huawei dorado v6' create new volume from snapshot error

change the luncopy mode,in dorado v6 we use clone_pair
modified some interface to call dorado v6

Closes-Bug: #1942342
Change-Id: If26ebd6a94512b1d8ecc1b786f518f667fc19ffe
(cherry picked from commit 77da18785af7bede26d3478934864e293c6f4ef6)

subject: Fix docker group name
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-24 19:43:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix docker group name

devstack-plugin-container wrongfully assumes that the stack user name
is also the name of the group under which install the docker daemon.
This can cause devstack to install docker in such a way that the stack
user does not have permissions to access the docker socket, as seen in
[3].

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-plugin-container
[2] https://github.com/openstack/devstack-plugin-container/blob/f09c5c9/devstack/lib/docker#L27
[3] https://github.com/gophercloud/gophercloud/pull/2380#issuecomment-1094295137

Closes-Bug: 1970129
Change-Id: Id5f1fa24ebb09db10f0d56e4d6b111be66869b5a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix docker group name

devstack-plugin-container wrongfully assumes that the stack user name
is also the name of the group under which install the docker daemon.
This can cause devstack to install docker in such a way that the stack
user does not have permissions to access the docker socket, as seen in
[3].

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-plugin-container
[2] https://github.com/openstack/devstack-plugin-container/blob/f09c5c9/devstack/lib/docker#L27
[3] https://github.com/gophercloud/gophercloud/pull/2380#issuecomment-1094295137

Closes-Bug: 1970129
Change-Id: Id5f1fa24ebb09db10f0d56e4d6b111be66869b5a

[{'created': '2022-03-23 18:50:29.000000000', 'message': "fix 'huawei dorado v6' FC initiator can be added to host

change the fc initiator filter conditions. we add a config
min_fc_ini_online when the number of online fc initiator
more than the min_fc_ini_online, the online initiator will
added to host

Closes-Bug: #1942218
Change-Id: Idb284e3b5f1b9b427a390f1e105f890ce5d49992
(cherry picked from commit bb15d83b5f1045aeda144042feebc9fa713b0ee2)
"}]
commit_message:
fix 'huawei dorado v6' FC initiator can be added to host

change the fc initiator filter conditions. we add a config
min_fc_ini_online when the number of online fc initiator
more than the min_fc_ini_online, the online initiator will
added to host

Closes-Bug: #1942218
Change-Id: Idb284e3b5f1b9b427a390f1e105f890ce5d49992
(cherry picked from commit bb15d83b5f1045aeda144042feebc9fa713b0ee2)

and its support. Updating the python classifier also to reflect
the same.

commit_message:
Add support for verifying glance image signatures

We have support for creating them, but not for verifying them.
cyborg needs to verify them.

We should also add a flag to create image that will use the signature
creator and attach the properties correctly.

This needs to import stuff from castellan and cursive and rework to
be suitable for clients not just servers, then update castellan and
cursive to use sdk.

Change-Id: I80414b38a3ba313266547276ccdb1ba7b5cc3aa4

commit_message:
Remove the note of training-labs

Training-labs had been officially retired as no maintainer.
The information of training-labs has been deleting in the openstack
documentatioan. It is not appropriate to continue the presentation in
note form here.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-October/025586.html
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/training-labs/commit/e78d74f10558ab3e6a9a6fd7d45e617c15e9c3d8

Change-Id: I0ac3d05389041ac58fe2347171541ffaaf151fdf

As per tempest stable branch testing policy[1], adding the
newly released stable/yoga job and remove the EM stable/ussuri
job.

Change-Id: Ia00b2eb2c3dc120469c2731a21ba28f8fc1c2714

commit_message:
Update 'Maintained' stable branch jobs on master gate

We have stable/yoga released and stable/ussuri is in
'Extended Maintenance' state. Current 'Maintained'
stable branches are yoga, xena, wallaby, and victoria.

As per tempest stable branch testing policy[1], adding the
newly released stable/yoga job and remove the EM stable/ussuri
job.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

Change-Id: Ia00b2eb2c3dc120469c2731a21ba28f8fc1c2714

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-22 09:25:57.000000000', 'message': "db: Close connection on early return

During review of change Ic43c21038ee682f9733fbde42c6d24f8088815fc, we
noticed that we were leaking connections if we had an early return from
'_archive_deleted_rows_for_table'. Correct this.

Change-Id: I748d962b6c7012e9bc2b8c91519da99d2d4bd240
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
db: Close connection on early return

During review of change Ic43c21038ee682f9733fbde42c6d24f8088815fc, we
noticed that we were leaking connections if we had an early return from
'_archive_deleted_rows_for_table'. Correct this.

Change-Id: I748d962b6c7012e9bc2b8c91519da99d2d4bd240
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-14 16:48:49.000000000', 'message': "Allow os_neutron to run in check mode

Let role fetch config file/u-c regardless of mode. These are safe
operations to run in check mode and shouldn't affect anything.

Change-Id: I09305017f63993a9bd665f1887b6cc0b6beb6e5b
"}]
commit_message:
Allow os_neutron to run in check mode

Let role fetch config file/u-c regardless of mode. These are safe
operations to run in check mode and shouldn't affect anything.

Change-Id: I09305017f63993a9bd665f1887b6cc0b6beb6e5b

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-15 09:50:37.000000000', 'message': 'Replace include for newer ansible version

In order to pass functional tests on newer ansible we need to replace
dropped inlcude with proper import_playbook module.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests/+/838099
Change-Id: I2bf9ca6003b66d5f7b8be9d7b54e12cb9b56f3c6
'}, {'created': '2022-04-15 09:55:00.000000000', 'message': 'Replace include for newer ansible version

In order to pass functional tests on newer ansible we need to replace
dropped inlcude with proper import_playbook module.

Change-Id: I2bf9ca6003b66d5f7b8be9d7b54e12cb9b56f3c6
'}]
commit_message:
Replace include for newer ansible version

In order to pass functional tests on newer ansible we need to replace
dropped inlcude with proper import_playbook module.

Change-Id: I2bf9ca6003b66d5f7b8be9d7b54e12cb9b56f3c6

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-14 16:06:06.000000000', 'message': "Allow to run cinder role in check mode

Always fetch config files as it's treated as safe operation.
On top of that handle case when there's no local config specified.

Change-Id: I5f5f36da96672679d6801c2a52c58d86657ca612
"}]
commit_message:
Allow to run cinder role in check mode

Always fetch config files as it's treated as safe operation.
On top of that handle case when there's no local config specified.

Change-Id: I5f5f36da96672679d6801c2a52c58d86657ca612

[{'created': '2022-01-17 20:13:31.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add multiple hugepage size job

hugepage sizes configured. This commit attempts to create a new job that
satisfies that criteria. In order to avoid issues with file backed
memory that test is excluded from the job.

commit_message:
Add tasks that adds hugepages to computes

In order to evaluate [1] upstream we need a job that has multiple
hugepage sizes configured. This commit adds tasks into job setup that
allows for the setup of hugepages. In preperation of adding a hugepage
focused job also removing num_hugepages variable
whitebox-devstack-multinode job.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1831269

Change-Id: If6bdb8917fc417c7d875af0376403a3ae171afcf

commit_message:
Stop using an admin endpoint by default

With V3 of the identity API, we no longer need to have a dedicated admin
endpoint, so stop requesting one by default, allowing deployments to
actually work without one.

Signed-off-by: Dr. Jens Harbott <harbott@osism.tech>
Change-Id: I96cc9c14008bcc59992d06c89f8f50895390f11e

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-20 21:18:32.000000000', 'message': "tests: fix functional tests

Neutron introduces an additional layer of protection when it comes
to dead VLANs, however, the VPNaaS did not have that change in it's
tests which meant that traffic was not reachable inside the
functional tests[1].

This patch changes the base class of the TestIPSecBase to use the
L3AgentTestFramework instead, and does a small refactor of the
setUp() function as well to remove extra calls.

This should stop any further changes in Neutron from breaking VPNaaS
since hopefully that class will carry the fixes down.  However, there
are a lot of duplicated code from the base class into this one,
however, this patch is focused at making a simple backportable
change for now.  Long term, it would be good to drop more of the
redundant code in there.

[1]: I0391dd24224f8656a09ddb002e7dae8783ba37a4

Change-Id: I04793caeaa71adbb1abcbda58aa43e63ce51d1e6

commit_message:
tests: fix functional tests

Neutron introduces an additional layer of protection when it comes
to dead VLANs, however, the VPNaaS did not have that change in it's
tests which meant that traffic was not reachable inside the
functional tests[1].

This patch changes the base class of the TestIPSecBase to use the
L3AgentTestFramework instead, and does a small refactor of the
setUp() function as well to remove extra calls.

This should stop any further changes in Neutron from breaking VPNaaS
since hopefully that class will carry the fixes down.  However, there
are a lot of duplicated code from the base class into this one,
however, this patch is focused at making a simple backportable
change for now.  Long term, it would be good to drop more of the
redundant code in there.

[1]: I0391dd24224f8656a09ddb002e7dae8783ba37a4

Change-Id: I04793caeaa71adbb1abcbda58aa43e63ce51d1e6

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-20 23:21:37.000000000', 'message': 'Register common config options by default

The [1] change modified the behavior Neutron had, which used to
force the default config options to be automatically set.

Neutron VPNaaS expects some of the default config options
to be set while initializing some services. If they aren not set
the initialization will fail similar to neutron-dynamic-routing[2].

This change invokes the method that sets such config options to
fix this initialization issue.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/837392
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-dynamic-routing/+/838780

Change-Id: I5c309c1ca8a7162b2a42b60bb3ee66df2c93fbae
'}]
commit_message:
Register common config options by default

The [1] change modified the behavior Neutron had, which used to
force the default config options to be automatically set.

Neutron VPNaaS expects some of the default config options
to be set while initializing some services. If they aren not set
the initialization will fail similar to neutron-dynamic-routing[2].

This change invokes the method that sets such config options to
fix this initialization issue.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/837392
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-dynamic-routing/+/838780

Change-Id: I5c309c1ca8a7162b2a42b60bb3ee66df2c93fbae

messages: [{'account_id': 30561, 'date': '2022-04-22 21:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2022-04-22 22:34:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-22 21:57:27.000000000', 'message': 'Add wording around upgrade availability

A deployment can be left with misleading messaging
in `juju status` output if the `prepare` sub-command
is invoked when an LTS upgrade candidate is not
available.

Change-Id: Iaabe4ab544b84b8fca6281bbd50cb1521d1032ee
'}]
commit_message:
Add wording around upgrade availability

A deployment can be left with misleading messaging
in `juju status` output if the `prepare` sub-command
is invoked when an LTS upgrade candidate is not
available.

Change-Id: Iaabe4ab544b84b8fca6281bbd50cb1521d1032ee

Remove redundant override of logging_context_format_string

The target value is exactly same as the default defined in oslo.log,
thus this override is just redundant.

commit_message:
Modify path for APIMicroversionFixture

The path 'tempest.api.volume.api_microversion_fixture.APIMicroversionFixture'
is deprecated and produces a deprecation warning[1] when running tests.
The deprecated path will be removed in Zed and we should use the
path 'tempest.lib.common.api_microversion_fixture.APIMicroversionFixture'
instead.

[1] 2022-04-22 14:00:28,241 843455 WARNING
[tempest.api.volume.api_microversion_fixture]
APIMicroversionFixture class is deprecated and moved to
tempest.lib.common.api_microversion_fixture.APIMicroversionFixture.
It will be removed in Z cycle.

Change-Id: Ie7f16f9671e3c2392a9f2ae1071d84915b48a85e

commit_message:
DOC: fix the uri for share group types

1. Use group-specs instead of group_specs for share group type.
2. Use access instead of share_type_access for share group types.

commit_message:
Redo home page

To conform to documentation best practices add structure
to the home page (via the Diataxis framework). A Sphinx
extension is used to display panels.

The Release notes quadrant/panel will become the Reference
section once there is material to put there. The Release
notes will then fall under the Project hierarchy.

Add custom CSS to make the above panels respect the page's
text width.

Resurrect the search facility in a more direct manner.

Move the code of conduct reference to the home page.

Change-Id: I963d5f5b3e81b021747c0050fedd208e68ab920e

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-08 15:54:51.000000000', 'message': "db: Don't rely on autocommit behavior

Resolve the following RemovedIn20Warning warning:

  The current statement is being autocommitted using implicit
  autocommit, which will be removed in SQLAlchemy 2.0. Use the .begin()
  method of Engine or Connection in order to use an explicit transaction
  for DML and DDL statements.

I genuinely expected this one to be more difficult to resolve, but we
weren't using this as much as expected (thank you, non-legacy
enginefacade).

With this change, we appear to be SQLAlchemy 2.0 ready.

Change-Id: Ic43c21038ee682f9733fbde42c6d24f8088815fc
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
db: Don't rely on autocommit behavior

Resolve the following RemovedIn20Warning warning:

  The current statement is being autocommitted using implicit
  autocommit, which will be removed in SQLAlchemy 2.0. Use the .begin()
  method of Engine or Connection in order to use an explicit transaction
  for DML and DDL statements.

I genuinely expected this one to be more difficult to resolve, but we
weren't using this as much as expected (thank you, non-legacy
enginefacade).

With this change, we appear to be SQLAlchemy 2.0 ready.

Change-Id: Ic43c21038ee682f9733fbde42c6d24f8088815fc
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2022-04-08 15:54:51.000000000', 'message': "db: Replace use of Column.copy() method

Resolve the following RemovedIn20Warning warning:

  The Column.copy() method is deprecated and will be removed in a future
  release.

The recommended solution here (by zzzeek himself) is to use the private
method. This method isn't perfect (hence why the public version was
deprecated) but it's more than okay for what we want. The alternative is
to effectively vendor a variant of the 'Column.copy()' code, which means
we'll lose out on any future bug fixes.

Change-Id: Ia663251dfa7cf8f7d33f19902a92bcc586ae9f43
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
db: Replace use of Column.copy() method

Resolve the following RemovedIn20Warning warning:

  The Column.copy() method is deprecated and will be removed in a future
  release.

The recommended solution here (by zzzeek himself) is to use the private
method. This method isn't perfect (hence why the public version was
deprecated) but it's more than okay for what we want. The alternative is
to effectively vendor a variant of the 'Column.copy()' code, which means
we'll lose out on any future bug fixes.

Change-Id: Ia663251dfa7cf8f7d33f19902a92bcc586ae9f43
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2022-04-08 15:54:51.000000000', 'message': 'db: Remove inplicit coercion of SELECTs

Resolve the following RemovedIn20Warning warning:

  Implicit coercion of SELECT and textual SELECT constructs into FROM
  clauses is deprecated; please call .subquery() on any Core select or
  ORM Query object in order to produce a subquery object.

This one was easy.

Change-Id: Ifeab2aa8cef7ad151d5d5f92937e90ab34b96e8a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
db: Remove inplicit coercion of SELECTs

Resolve the following RemovedIn20Warning warning:

  Implicit coercion of SELECT and textual SELECT constructs into FROM
  clauses is deprecated; please call .subquery() on any Core select or
  ORM Query object in order to produce a subquery object.

This one was easy.

Change-Id: Ifeab2aa8cef7ad151d5d5f92937e90ab34b96e8a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

the remote_addr attribute. This change fixes the wrong attribute
accordingly.

Change-Id: Id5880142bd9472b4b3caff21a0d1f7b2900f0e48
'}, {'created': '2022-04-03 15:23:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix wrong attribute to find remote address

The webob.Request class does not have the remote_address attribute but
the remote_addr attribute. This change fixes usage of the non-existing
attribute accordingly.

'}]
commit_message:
Fix wrong attribute to find remote address

The webob.Request class does not have the remote_address attribute but
the remote_addr attribute. This change fixes usage of the non-existing
attribute accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1967683
Change-Id: Id5880142bd9472b4b3caff21a0d1f7b2900f0e48

commit_message:
Update to build using charmcraft - xena batch

Batch to add building by charmcraft for the xena batch.
Supports just wallaby and xena in gate.

Updates the charm overlay for appropriate netapp values.
local_overlay_enabled is set to True as it now defaults to False.

Note that the actual functional tests are still disabled due to [1]

1 - https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-manila-netapp/+bug/1922214

Change-Id: Icbb9ad3a77d65ac0cc6de5fabdf360bd9c9e378d

commit_message:
Debug log libvirt metadata version fails

We don't need to log this as a warning or info.
If you have upgraded from an older version it just
outputs that line times the amount of instances on
the compute node every minute.

Change-Id: Ic0f4ca41d2e4114800aba9d02309f2e04e313752
(cherry picked from commit 9a08b529a781eb787f17a52e2dfbe503069e0ad5)

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-19 15:06:09.000000000', 'message': 'Manila: Replace hiera by lookup

The hiera function is deprecated and does not work with the latest
hieradata version 5. It should be replaced by the new lookup
function[1].

[1] https://puppet.com/docs/puppet/7/hiera_automatic.html

With the lookup function, we can define value type and merge behavior,
but these are kept default at this moment to limit scope of this change
to just simple replacement. Adding value type might be useful to make
sure the value is in expected type (especially when a boolean value is
expected), but we will revisit that later.

example:
lookup(<NAME>, [<VALUE TYPE>], [<MERGE BEHAVIOR>], [<DEFAULT VALUE>])

Change-Id: I2614b8f42c45ba9f5143d51401c1d48d469a4ef8

commit_message:
Manila: Replace hiera by lookup

The hiera function is deprecated and does not work with the latest
hieradata version 5. It should be replaced by the new lookup
function[1].

[1] https://puppet.com/docs/puppet/7/hiera_automatic.html

With the lookup function, we can define value type and merge behavior,
but these are kept default at this moment to limit scope of this change
to just simple replacement. Adding value type might be useful to make
sure the value is in expected type (especially when a boolean value is
expected), but we will revisit that later.

example:
lookup(<NAME>, [<VALUE TYPE>], [<MERGE BEHAVIOR>], [<DEFAULT VALUE>])

Change-Id: I2614b8f42c45ba9f5143d51401c1d48d469a4ef8

commit_message:
Fix detection of member operating status DRAIN

When querying the status from HAProxy all values get read as
strings. Because the check wrongly assumed integer type values
it never detected the DRAIN status.

Story: 2009817
Task: 44389

Change-Id: If7d68c95173b8da66050659d1fb86225880dafdd
(cherry picked from commit d350f0908f5111cf2791feed9ea83219c8b984fb)
(cherry picked from commit 9718e036926b2423980656bd3a6c2d3dfaa3f294)
(cherry picked from commit 0b0131583bcf0863827da0cd81029eb7f285aa8d)

commit_message:
VMware: Early fail spawn if memory is not multiple of 4.

If instance memory is not multiple of 4, creating instance on ESXi
fails with error "['GenericVmConfigFault'] VimFaultException: Memory
(RAM) size is invalid.". However this is after instance is built and
tried to launch on ESXi. Add check in prepare_for_spawn to trigger
failure early and avoid further steps i.e. build as well as launch.

Closes-Bug: #1966987
Change-Id: I7ed8ac986283cd455e54e3f18ab955f43b3248d0

This will need a test of some kind, otherwise we can't protect it against regression. Since this impacts people using keystoneclient, it should include a release note [0].

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/contributor/release-notes.html"}, {'account_id': 28119, 'date': '2018-08-20 15:06:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 28119, 'date': '2018-08-20 15:15:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 28119, 'date': '2018-08-20 18:34:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-08-20 22:10:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I am inclined to go with "debug is meant for debugging purposes", which means the logging is correct of the response. It is recommended not to run in debug mode in cases where the logging should not occur. 

I am leaving this as no score, but I am a soft -1 on hamstringing the debug output.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-08-20 22:14:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

See comment on bug, changing to -1'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-09-28 00:49:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

Hi Kripa. Thanks for the patch. But can you provide a test case for this log case of yours.?'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2020-01-28 17:18:11.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Morgan Fainberg with the following votes:

* Code-Review-1 by Morgan Fainberg <morgan.fainberg@gmail.com>
'}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2022-04-22 15:50:36.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Logging during debug does not seem like an issue.  Feel free to reopen this patch if it is needed.'}]

commit_message:
Allow user to skip logging of user API response.

With debug enabled, personal information like email in GET user API
response is logged. This fix is to let user pass log=False parameter
in keystoneclient.users.get() method in order to skip logging
of personal information in GET user API response.

Change-Id: I9658adaa183718810da1ccbaba1d7789023253c5
Closes-bug: #1771203

[{'created': '2022-03-29 12:19:35.000000000', 'message': 'Pass timeout_dict to _get_haproxy_versions

The timeout_dict args was ignored when calling _get_haproxy_versions

_get_haproxy_versions might be the first function (that uses the amphora
API) that is called from rest_api_driver, it should respect the
timeout_dict passed by the tasks of the controller (for instance during
a failover a custom timeout_dict is used in order to optimize the
failover of missing amphorae)

Task 44232

commit_message:
Pass timeout_dict to _get_haproxy_versions

The timeout_dict args was ignored when calling _get_haproxy_versions

_get_haproxy_versions might be the first function (that uses the amphora
API) that is called from rest_api_driver, it should respect the
timeout_dict passed by the tasks of the controller (for instance during
a failover a custom timeout_dict is used in order to optimize the
failover of missing amphorae)

Story 2009761
Task 44232

Change-Id: I48a02780adf54b8d6d3bedada448a4f91e0539ed
(cherry picked from commit 6d6a8bdf6c53c20ae5864ae61785ed902e468ae8)
(cherry picked from commit 1da04d126a007416c0ba0822031818371266dd95)
(cherry picked from commit 4e1cc209f7ba63ea9bf3eec1c0557da5bc2cac56)

commit_message:
Octavia: Avoid hard-coding default of default ciphers parameters

... and use the service default value when these parameters are unset.
With this change we no longer need to maintaining the default value.

Print a human readable error if tls certs are not provided

Print a human readable error if tls certs are not provided when using
ldaps:// or use_tls and not providing CA certificates.

commit_message:
Fix generated policies and samples.

due to escaping/quoting issues, currently default policy file
produced for glance with oslopolicy-policy-generator is not a valid JSON/YAML
(same for generated policy sample if one uncomments actual rules).

This patch swaps the single and double quotes in the definition of some
policies so that they are rendered correctly.

Change-Id: I48ce88f4f398e05818457b00cfc8dda90f3c9c91

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-30 07:49:50.000000000', 'message': "ovn migration: Fix check for stack name

[1] Updated the migration script to check for config-download
directory instead of stack, but missed update the Error
message.

This patch removes the usage of check_stack
function which is no longer required as we now checking
config-download directory. If source inventory file doesn't exist
the script will report Error message and exit.

This is follow up of [1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/834925

Related-Bug: #1966099
Change-Id: I2416fba50fc495da4d59a3f335f33d831ca6e91d
"}, {'created': '2022-04-12 11:47:37.000000000', 'message': "ovn migration: Fix check for stack name

[1] Updated the migration script to check for config-download
directory instead of stack, but missed update the Error
message.

check_stack function is renamed to check_source_inventory
as now it only checks for source inventory instead of heat
stack.
If source inventory file doesn't exist the script
will report Error message and exit.

This is follow up of [1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/834925

Related-Bug: #1966099
Change-Id: I2416fba50fc495da4d59a3f335f33d831ca6e91d
"}]
commit_message:
ovn migration: Fix check for stack name

[1] Updated the migration script to check for config-download
directory instead of stack, but missed update the Error
message.

check_stack function is renamed to check_source_inventory
as now it only checks for source inventory instead of heat
stack.
If source inventory file doesn't exist the script
will report Error message and exit.

This is follow up of [1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/834925

Related-Bug: #1966099
Change-Id: I2416fba50fc495da4d59a3f335f33d831ca6e91d

commit_message:
Fix the bug of TypeError with JsonFilter

The default scheduler_hints value is None, and if we don't pass
the scheduler_hints , It will report TypeError when creating share
with JsonFilter with Rest API. The TypeError exception is added to
solve this problem.

Change-Id: Iad89491cbbaccac8df161f8f1157c7ebf3291458
Closes-Bug: #1959472

commit_message:
Usage of new trait of OWNER_NOVA

As talked on the Yoga[1] and zed[2] PTG, we should add a new trait of OWNER_NOVA for the resources that nova reports and propose the spec for the usage of OWNER_NOVA trait.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/nova-yoga-ptg
[2] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/nova-zed-ptg

Change-Id: I8625935364acb9a0cd739fdb4e81c0a55e8608ce

commit_message:
Pass timeout_dict to _get_haproxy_versions

The timeout_dict args was ignored when calling _get_haproxy_versions

_get_haproxy_versions might be the first function (that uses the amphora
API) that is called from rest_api_driver, it should respect the
timeout_dict passed by the tasks of the controller (for instance during
a failover a custom timeout_dict is used in order to optimize the
failover of missing amphorae)

Story 2009761
Task 44232

Change-Id: I48a02780adf54b8d6d3bedada448a4f91e0539ed
(cherry picked from commit 6d6a8bdf6c53c20ae5864ae61785ed902e468ae8)
(cherry picked from commit 1da04d126a007416c0ba0822031818371266dd95)
(cherry picked from commit 4e1cc209f7ba63ea9bf3eec1c0557da5bc2cac56)

commit_message:
Fix detection of member operating status DRAIN

When querying the status from HAProxy all values get read as
strings. Because the check wrongly assumed integer type values
it never detected the DRAIN status.

Story: 2009817
Task: 44389

Change-Id: If7d68c95173b8da66050659d1fb86225880dafdd
(cherry picked from commit d350f0908f5111cf2791feed9ea83219c8b984fb)

messages:
[{'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2022-03-31 04:53:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2022-03-31 10:13:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-31 04:53:08.000000000', 'message': 'Make 'tox -e fast-specs' fail on sphinx warnings

I'm not sure if others will want this but when I made an edit on my
spec and ran 'tox -e fast-specs', my expectation was that it was a fast
way to check whether the edits I made would pass openstack-tox-docs in
the gate. This turned out not to be the case, 'tox -e fast-specs'
showed the "fast-specs: commands succeeded" message but when I uploaded
the change, the openstack-tox-docs job failed because there was a
sphinx parsing error in my spec.

This adds -W to the sphinx-build call to treat warnings as errors to
match 'tox -e docs' and openstack-tox-docs. It also runs sphinx-build
via exec to make the script fail if sphinx-build returns non-zero.

Change-Id: I9de750e7f44a746d4466c522004d0c2a624052e2
'}]
commit_message:
Make 'tox -e fast-specs' fail on sphinx warnings

I'm not sure if others will want this but when I made an edit on my
spec and ran 'tox -e fast-specs', my expectation was that it was a fast
way to check whether the edits I made would pass openstack-tox-docs in
the gate. This turned out not to be the case, 'tox -e fast-specs'
showed the "fast-specs: commands succeeded" message but when I uploaded
the change, the openstack-tox-docs job failed because there was a
sphinx parsing error in my spec.

This adds -W to the sphinx-build call to treat warnings as errors to
match 'tox -e docs' and openstack-tox-docs. It also runs sphinx-build
via exec to make the script fail if sphinx-build returns non-zero.

Change-Id: I9de750e7f44a746d4466c522004d0c2a624052e2

commit_message:
Add doc fix for all-in-one in venv

When running in virtual environment a bootstrapping task will
install 'docker' python module in the environment. After that
prechecks and deploy phase will not find the module because
their 'ansible interpreter' is host wide. With this fix it is
advised to set an interpreter to the one in virtual environment

Closes-Bug: #1969812
Change-Id: I1bb6a3af3fa6346fff0a262e0c53d12c544f46db

commit_message:
[kuryr] Transition Victoria to EM

This transition the victoria branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

The transition deadline is April 27th, 2022.

Change-Id: If8c47aa985eef01543edcc028065c4899ca24723

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-25 16:25:03.000000000', 'message': 'nova: use any_errors_fatal for once-per-cell tasks

We run some nova tasks once per cell, using a condition to match a
single host in the cell. In other similar tasks, we use run_once, which
will fail all hosts if the task fails. Typically these tasks are
critical, and that is desirable. However, with the approach used in
nova-cell to support multiple cells, if a once-per-cell task fails, then
other hosts will continue to execute, which could lead to unexpected
results.

This change adds any_errors_fatal to the plays or blocks that run these
tasks.

Closes-Bug: #1948694

Change-Id: I2a5871ccd4e8198171ef3239ce95f475f3e4b051
'}, {'created': '2022-04-22 10:37:25.000000000', 'message': 'nova: use any_errors_fatal for once-per-cell tasks

We run some nova tasks once per cell, using a condition to match a
single host in the cell. In other similar tasks, we use run_once, which
will fail all hosts if the task fails. Typically these tasks are
critical, and that is desirable. However, with the approach used in
nova-cell to support multiple cells, if a once-per-cell task fails, then
other hosts will continue to execute, which could lead to unexpected
results.

This change adds any_errors_fatal to the plays or blocks that run these
tasks.

Closes-Bug: #1948694

Change-Id: I2a5871ccd4e8198171ef3239ce95f475f3e4b051
'}]
commit_message:
nova: use any_errors_fatal for once-per-cell tasks

We run some nova tasks once per cell, using a condition to match a
single host in the cell. In other similar tasks, we use run_once, which
will fail all hosts if the task fails. Typically these tasks are
critical, and that is desirable. However, with the approach used in
nova-cell to support multiple cells, if a once-per-cell task fails, then
other hosts will continue to execute, which could lead to unexpected
results.

This change adds any_errors_fatal to the plays or blocks that run these
tasks.

Closes-Bug: #1948694

Change-Id: I2a5871ccd4e8198171ef3239ce95f475f3e4b051

commit_message:
Fix detection of member operating status DRAIN

When querying the status from HAProxy all values get read as
strings. Because the check wrongly assumed integer type values
it never detected the DRAIN status.

Story: 2009817
Task: 44389

Change-Id: If7d68c95173b8da66050659d1fb86225880dafdd

commit_message:
Getting instance shutdown xml issue

For shutdown instances, using instance name instead of instance
id (vm id) is not permanent to get instance xml data.

Closes-Bug: #1961550
Change-Id: I295924cac7d2d6df276af038a53acfb435fe06c7
(cherry picked from commit 24937261d46a7216ee4d553e61e90e669746efc0)

commit_message:
[sfc] Remove _log_console_output & ping_ip_address

As tempest.scenario.manager was announced stable interface in Tempest
27.0.0[1] it can be now reused in plugins.

Removed methods:
    * _log_console_output
    * ping_ip_address

Etherpad concerning this effort:
https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tempest-scenario-manager-cleanup

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/tempest/v27.0.0.html#release-notes-27-0-0

Change-Id: If4fca62b90ca1af41ec1fae7c64eed2da9c3bbfb

commit_message:
[sfc] Remove create_server & get_remote_client

As tempest.scenario.manager was announced stable interface in Tempest
27.0.0[1] it can be now reused in plugins.

Removed methods:
    * create_server
    * get_remote_client

Etherpad concerning this effort:
https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tempest-scenario-manager-cleanup

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/tempest/v27.0.0.html#release-notes-27-0-0

Change-Id: If2566d6262cf2b40487acbfe2eb2329d0977e0dd

commit_message:
adjust permissions on _extend_start files (part II)

Tim Shearer started it in 1d96a2bbe1b536b7d7f4cdbf55c6dabae6d058ae.

Since all extend_start files are sourced rather than executed, the executable
bits are now cleared throughout the project.

Change-Id: Ia1797c32fc6a35f9f077c673abf4d8e16e51a760

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-08 11:01:47.000000000', 'message': "	refactor a code to add support for create a share network bug in the cli

	Previously, share network create was taking one argument, by adding cli support
	it is taking both arguments now and shared network is created successfully.
	The 'find_resource()' method there calls out to the AvailabilityZoneManager
	however manager doesnot support getting one resource by its name.
	So 'find_resource()' method was dropped and 'availability_zone' value was set to
       'parsed_args.availability_zone' to solve the problem.

	Closes-Bug: 1962288

Change-Id: I3ec926122eed932caebcb31b9afd0f811f1f3c8e
"}, {'created': '2022-04-12 06:49:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fix share network create command with the AZ option

Previously, "share network create" command was trying to look up
the availability-zone provided by the user. However, this is not supported
by the AvailabilityZoneManager.

Drop the AZ lookup if the option is used and pass the user provided value
to the API.

Closes-Bug: 1962288
Change-Id: I3ec926122eed932caebcb31b9afd0f811f1f3c8e
'}, {'created': '2022-04-18 18:11:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix share network create command with the AZ option

commit_message:
Fix share network create command with the AZ option

Previously, "share network create" command was trying to look up
the availability-zone provided by the user. However, this is not supported
by the AvailabilityZoneManager.

Drop the AZ lookup if the option is used and pass the user provided value
to the API.

Closes-Bug: 1962288
Change-Id: I3ec926122eed932caebcb31b9afd0f811f1f3c8e

OpenStack SDK removed support for the deprecated image property
protected in commit afb49692 [1][2]. This replaces the usage of
protected with is_protected in openstack.cloud.image but adds
protected as an alias to not break backward compatibility for
user code. This breaks backward compatibility to older OpenStack
SDK releases though.

Ref.:
[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/afb49692f5bfab259af8c594eedbddcb52cbde81

Change-Id: I5044c927e90c650234fbc22375f44e6841a485a1
'}]
commit_message:
Renamed image property protected to is_protected

OpenStack SDK removed support for the deprecated image property
protected in commit afb49692 [1][2]. This replaces the usage of
protected with is_protected in openstack.cloud.image but adds
protected as an alias to not break backward compatibility for
user code. This breaks backward compatibility to older OpenStack
SDK releases though.

Ref.:
[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/afb49692f5bfab259af8c594eedbddcb52cbde81
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstacksdk/+/820926

Change-Id: I5044c927e90c650234fbc22375f44e6841a485a1

commit_message:
grafana: drop check for not supported architectures

Kolla supports only AArch64 and x86-64 so there is no need to check for
other architectures.

Change-Id: I44e45492bcbdd56a5c985ba84bad66202c9fde55

commit_message:
Updates for stable branch creation

- Set default branch for git review/gerrit.
- Switch tests to stable.
- Switch to using stable charm-helpers branch.
- Switch to using stable charm.openstack branch.
- Switch to using stable zaza, zaza-openstack-tests
  branch
- (reactive charms) Add build.lock file

Change-Id: Ic7b0d26815f3b6796017a0fecff556fab2d92ad9

value in the comment and the sample value in the document to
be consistent with it.

commit_message:
[bgpvpn] Remove unused scenario.manager methods

As tempest.scenario.manager was announced stable interface in Tempest
27.0.0[1] it can be now reused in plugins.

Removed methods:
    * create_server
    * check_public_network_connectivity
    * _associate_floating_ip
    * _disassociate_floating_ip
    * check_floating_ip_status
    * _check_tenant_network_connectivity
    * _update_router_admin_state
    * create_networks
    * check_vm_connectivity
    * _get_router
    * ping_ip_address
    * _create_subnet
    * _log_net_info
    * _get_network_by_name

Etherpad concerning this effort:
https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tempest-scenario-manager-cleanup

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/tempest/v27.0.0.html#release-notes-27-0-0

Change-Id: Id267ccaaa29ab6ee76bf8789484f1975542d5090

commit_message:
[fwaas] Remove unused methods

As tempest.scenario.manager was announced stable interface in Tempest
27.0.0[1] it can be now reused in plugins. This patch removes unused
methods.

Removed methods:
    * check_public_network_connectivity
    * _associate_floating_ip
    * _disassociate_floating_ip
    * check_floating_ip_status
    * _check_tenant_network_connectivity
    * _update_router_admin_state
    * create_networks
    * _log_net_info
    * _get_network_by_name
    * _check_remote_connectivity
    * _get_router

Etherpad concerning this effort:
https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tempest-scenario-manager-cleanup

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/tempest/v27.0.0.html#release-notes-27-0-0

Change-Id: Iaf336377dc003ecb0e7f5d1f2d825261e8da0c4a

commit_message:
Update netcommon collection

Version 2.6.0 of netcommon doesn't include ipaddr filter anymore, thus
at this point every place where filter is required should use it from
utils collection explicitly.

Change-Id: I7ad24a6e8ad301a9a1197d1ebe65f5be1ec6ac08

commit_message:
Deprecate [DEFAULT] use_forwarded_for

... because functionality of this parameter is effectively duplicate of
the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in oslo.middleware library.

Closes-Bug: #1967686
Change-Id: I4db615093b739c7ff582f348a6fb6eabb8068257

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-21 09:44:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix AttributeError in exception handler

The exception handler of save_state() caused an AttributeError
because it tried to get the output attribute of the Exception,
which does not exist in general. Added a test to cover this
scenario.

Change-Id: I36acdee1f8782b17c234f6b250facc5c8d0aaf87
'}]
commit_message:
Fix AttributeError in exception handler

The exception handler of save_state() caused an AttributeError
because it tried to get the output attribute of the Exception,
which does not exist in general. Added a test to cover this
scenario.

Change-Id: I36acdee1f8782b17c234f6b250facc5c8d0aaf87

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-23 08:23:46.000000000', 'message': "nova: don't fail all hosts on service registration failures

If any nova compute service fails to register itself, Kolla Ansible will
fail all hosts. This can lead to issues at scale where failures are more
frequent.

This change modifies the behaviour to query the compute service list
until all expected hosts are present, but does not fail the play if they
are not. Two new tasks are added that execute for all hosts (without
run_once), and fail only those hosts that have not registered
successfully.

Change-Id: I12c1928cf1f1fb9e28f1741e7fe4968004ea1816
Closes-Bug: #1940119
"}, {'created': '2021-08-25 09:19:07.000000000', 'message': "nova: don't fail all hosts on service registration failures

fail all hosts. This can lead to issues at scale where failures are more

until all expected hosts are present, but does not fail the play if they
are not. Two new tasks are added that execute for all hosts (without
run_once), and fail only those hosts that have not registered
successfully.

Change-Id: I12c1928cf1f1fb9e28f1741e7fe4968004ea1816
Closes-Bug: #1940119
"}, {'created': '2021-10-25 13:15:43.000000000', 'message': "nova: don't fail all hosts on service registration failures

fail all hosts. This can lead to issues at scale where failures are more

until all expected hosts are present, but does not fail the play if they

Change-Id: I12c1928cf1f1fb9e28f1741e7fe4968004ea1816
Closes-Bug: #1940119
"}, {'created': '2021-10-25 16:25:03.000000000', 'message': "nova: don't fail all hosts on service registration failures

If any nova compute service fails to register itself, Kolla Ansible will
fail all hosts. This can lead to issues at scale where failures are more
frequent.

This change modifies the behaviour to query the compute service list
until all expected hosts are present, but does not fail the play if they
are not. Two new tasks are added that execute for all hosts (without
run_once), and fail only those hosts that have not registered
successfully.

Change-Id: I12c1928cf1f1fb9e28f1741e7fe4968004ea1816
Closes-Bug: #1940119
"}, {'created': '2022-03-28 16:31:47.000000000', 'message': "nova: don't fail all hosts on service registration failures

If any nova compute service fails to register itself, Kolla Ansible will
fail all hosts. This can lead to issues at scale where failures are more
frequent.

This change modifies the behaviour to query the compute service list
until all expected hosts are present, but does not fail the play if they
are not. A new task is added that executes for all hosts (without
run_once), and fails only those hosts that have not registered
successfully.

If nova_compute_registration_fatal is set to true, only hosts on which
a compute service has failed to register will fail the deployment.

Change-Id: I12c1928cf1f1fb9e28f1741e7fe4968004ea1816
Closes-Bug: #1940119
"}, {'created': '2022-03-29 08:36:01.000000000', 'message': "nova: don't fail all hosts on service registration failures

If any nova compute service fails to register itself, Kolla Ansible will
fail all hosts. This can lead to issues at scale where failures are more
frequent.

This change modifies the behaviour to query the compute service list
until all expected hosts are present, but does not fail the play if they
are not. A new task is added that executes for all hosts (without
run_once), and fails only those hosts that have not registered
successfully.

If nova_compute_registration_fatal is set to true, only hosts on which
a compute service has failed to register will fail the deployment.

Change-Id: I12c1928cf1f1fb9e28f1741e7fe4968004ea1816
Closes-Bug: #1940119
"}, {'created': '2022-03-29 10:26:52.000000000', 'message': 'nova: improve compute service registration failure handling

If any nova compute service fails to register itself, Kolla Ansible will
fail the host that queries the Nova API. This is the first compute host
in the inventory, and fails in the task:

    Waiting for nova-compute services to register themselves

Other hosts continue, often leading to further errors later on. Clearly
this is not idea.

This change modifies the behaviour to query the compute service list
until all expected hosts are present, but does not fail the querying
host if they are not. A new task is added that executes for all hosts,
and fails only those hosts that have not registered successfully.

Alternatively, to fail all hosts in a cell when any compute service
fails to register, set nova_compute_registration_fatal to true.

Change-Id: I12c1928cf1f1fb9e28f1741e7fe4968004ea1816
Closes-Bug: #1940119
'}]
commit_message:
nova: improve compute service registration failure handling

If any nova compute service fails to register itself, Kolla Ansible will
fail the host that queries the Nova API. This is the first compute host
in the inventory, and fails in the task:

    Waiting for nova-compute services to register themselves

Other hosts continue, often leading to further errors later on. Clearly
this is not idea.

This change modifies the behaviour to query the compute service list
until all expected hosts are present, but does not fail the querying
host if they are not. A new task is added that executes for all hosts,
and fails only those hosts that have not registered successfully.

Alternatively, to fail all hosts in a cell when any compute service
fails to register, set nova_compute_registration_fatal to true.

Change-Id: I12c1928cf1f1fb9e28f1741e7fe4968004ea1816
Closes-Bug: #1940119

This is old and deprecated configuration settings for Swift not needed
anymore because kolla-ansible correctly configure glance-api.conf and
glance-swift.conf since Idddbf2ce741e0486d60e1de88c77a7f0332a5a2b when
kolla_enable_swift variable set to true. This change can be backported
through all releases till the Train.

Change-Id: I5273edc8265f115519f499e85fe12f8d22306c4b
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 10b8c1ead01c5372df40d565ac44a18ea20edc5e)
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup old and deprecated Swift configuration

This is old and deprecated configuration settings for Swift not needed
anymore because kolla-ansible correctly configure glance-api.conf and
glance-swift.conf since Idddbf2ce741e0486d60e1de88c77a7f0332a5a2b when
kolla_enable_swift variable set to true. This change can be backported
through all releases till the Train.

Change-Id: I5273edc8265f115519f499e85fe12f8d22306c4b
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 10b8c1ead01c5372df40d565ac44a18ea20edc5e)

commit_message:
[Train-only] Move upper-constraints for validations-libs to 1.6.0

Patch also bumps ansible-runner version to 1.4.6 in line with stable/ussuri.
As the ansible-runner==1.4.4 is dependency of validations-libs 1.6.0.

Change-Id: Ibbffdd0ce12b1b0a39717b5a9b6ded189795ae6c

commit_message:
Cleanup old and deprecated Swift configuration

This is old and deprecated configuration settings for Swift not needed
anymore because kolla-ansible correctly configure glance-api.conf and
glance-swift.conf since Idddbf2ce741e0486d60e1de88c77a7f0332a5a2b when
kolla_enable_swift variable set to true. This change can be backported
through all releases till the Train.

Change-Id: I5273edc8265f115519f499e85fe12f8d22306c4b
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-12 13:25:06.000000000', 'message': "[ovn][migration] Leave VIF details untouched

Before this patch, when migrating from ML2/OVS to ML2/OVN, we
removed the VIF details that are not used by OVN. However, this
changes how the VIFs are plugged if the hybrid iptables firewall
was used.

In order to not break the migration, we want to keep whatever
plugging was used in ML2/OVS. For this reason, this patch is
leaving the VIF details untouched.

The consequence is that, after migration, whatever workloads
used the hybrid plugging will remain like that. Newly created
VIFs will be plugged to the OVS bridge directly. As a result,
the migration to OVN won't require moving to the OVS firewall
first while in ML2/OVS.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez Sanchez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iad4fae7af54cc502ac0ba02a911cdd4fefa13535

commit_message:
[ovn][migration] Support migration to OVN from iptables firewall

Before this patch, when migrating from ML2/OVS to ML2/OVN, we
removed the VIF details that are not used by OVN. However, this
changes how the VIFs are plugged if the hybrid iptables firewall
was used.

In order to not break the migration, we want to keep whatever
plugging was used in ML2/OVS. For this reason, this patch is
leaving the VIF details untouched.

The consequence is that, after migration, whatever workloads
used the hybrid plugging will remain like that. Newly created
VIFs will be plugged to the OVS bridge directly. As a result,
the migration to OVN won't require moving to the OVS firewall
first while in ML2/OVS.

This patch is also removing the constraint that prevented the
migration if the hybrid firewall was used.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez Sanchez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iad4fae7af54cc502ac0ba02a911cdd4fefa13535

subject: Do not install recomended packages with apt
messages: [{'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2022-04-21 13:13:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2022-04-22 09:22:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nduplicate of a better patch'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-21 13:13:56.000000000', 'message': 'Do not install recomended packages with apt

This can lead to unexpected installation of things such as librbd
from the wrong repository, when installing other packages such
as lxd or qemu tools.

Change-Id: Id0964a1e1811b05815aa80048736083ddf854044
'}]
commit_message:
Do not install recomended packages with apt

This can lead to unexpected installation of things such as librbd
from the wrong repository, when installing other packages such
as lxd or qemu tools.

Change-Id: Id0964a1e1811b05815aa80048736083ddf854044

commit_message:
enable locking test fixture

os-brick 5.1 and later now uses file system locks
by default which were introduced by
I6f7f7d19540361204d4ae3ead2bd6dcddb8fcd68

As such we should be enabling the locking fixture
in the compute manager test class and block device
unit tests.

Change-Id: I184ed3ad3d578780524fbaa3a0392607d1a50cdc
Related-Bug: #1947370

[{'created': '2022-02-08 23:32:55.000000000', 'message': 'Make perfload jobs fail if write allocation fails

the server has responded with a HTTP error code and then fails the job

'}, {'created': '2022-02-10 18:01:05.000000000', 'message': 'Make perfload jobs fail if write allocation fails

This uses curl -f when writing an allocation in order to detect when
the server has responded with a HTTP error code and then fails the job
if so. The idea behind this is to catch when PUT
/allocations/{consumer_uuid} required parameters change and the
perfload jobs need to be updated.

A check for return code != 0 is also added to fail the job if any
commands in the sequence to write an allocation fails.

Change-Id: Ic06e64b1031ff37d7ada55449ae71cd39b1298a2
'}, {'created': '2022-04-01 23:41:31.000000000', 'message': 'Make perfload jobs fail if write allocation fails

This uses curl -f when writing an allocation in order to detect when
the server has responded with a HTTP error code and then fails the job
if so. The idea behind this is to catch when PUT
/allocations/{consumer_uuid} required parameters change and the
perfload jobs need to be updated.

The curl -S option is also added to show the error if curl fails.

Change-Id: Ic06e64b1031ff37d7ada55449ae71cd39b1298a2
'}]
commit_message:
Make perfload jobs fail if write allocation fails

This uses curl -f when writing an allocation in order to detect when
the server has responded with a HTTP error code and then fails the job
if so. The idea behind this is to catch when PUT
/allocations/{consumer_uuid} required parameters change and the
perfload jobs need to be updated.

The curl -S option is also added to show the error if curl fails.

Change-Id: Ic06e64b1031ff37d7ada55449ae71cd39b1298a2

commit_message:
Update python testing as per zed cycle teting runtime

In Zed cycle, we have dropped the python 3.6/3.7[1] testing
and its support. Removing the py36 centos8 job as well as
updating the python classifier also to reflect the same.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/zed.html

Change-Id: Iba5074ea6f981a7527e86cfc98edd1ed7dd3086f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-31 09:04:21.000000000', 'message': "Add a partition a basic partition diffing tool

A few weeks ago it was mentioned in channel that someone wished
they could compare builders to rings. So as a random lunch time
hack I created a partition diffing tool. I polished it up a bit
and thought it might be usful in the Swift tool box.

This patch adds a new tool, swift-partition-diff, which does
exactly what it says. It takes 2 builder or ring files
and does a comparasion on the _replica2parts2dev table and
will tell out how different they are.

  $ swift-partition-diff
  Usage: swift-partition-diff [--verbose] [--diffs] <builder1> <builder2>

  Options:
    -h, --help     show this help message and exit
    -v, --verbose  Print entire table
    -d, --diffs    Print only the diffs

In it's simplest form it takes in 2 builders or rings to compare:

  $ swift-partition-diff object.builder object.ring.gz
  Number of diffs: 0 (0.00%)
  $ echo $?
  0

There are a few ways to read the output. Firstly is the return code,
where:

  0 - no differences
  1 - there are differences
  2+ - Errors running diff tool

Obviously the other way is to read the output. Number represents:

  Number of diffs: <number of replicath's different> (<percentage>%)

If you want more information, you can pass the `--diffs` (`-d`) to print
the partiions that have changed:

  $ swift-partition-diff object.builder object.ring.gz -d
  b1: object.builder
  b2: object.ring.gz

  --------------------------
  | P  |   b1    |   b2    |
  --------------------------
  --------------------------

  Number of diffs: 0 (0.00%)

It obviously makes more sense on a ring that has changes, so lets take
one I've fiddled with:

  $ swift-partition-diff object.builder other-object.builder
  Number of diffs: 4 (0.13%)

  $ swift-partition-diff object.builder other-object.builder -d
  b1: object.builder
  b2: other-object.builder

  --------------------------
  | P  |   b1    |   b2    |
  --------------------------
  |0015| 3  0 (2)| 3  0 (0)|
  |0150|(0) 2  1 |(5) 2  1 |
  |0550| 3 (0) 2 | 3 (2) 2 |
  |1005| 1  3 (0)| 1  3 (3)|
  --------------------------

  Number of diffs: 4 (0.13%)

There is also a `--verbose` (`-v`) option, which will pring the entire
_replica2part2dev table. It looks pretty, but is obviously very verbose:

  $ swift-partition-diff object.builder other-object.builder -v
  b1: object.builder
  b2: other-object.builder

  --------------------------
  | P  |   b1    |   b2    |
  --------------------------
  |0000| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0001| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |0002| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0003| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0004| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0005| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |0006| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0007| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0008| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0009| 0  2  1 | 0  2  1 |
  |0010| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |0011| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |0012| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |0013| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0014| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |0015| 3  0 (2)| 3  0 (0)|
  |0016| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |0017| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0018| 0  2  1 | 0  2  1 |
  |0019| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0020| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
    .    .  .  .   .  .  .
  |1005| 1  3 (0)| 1  3 (3)|
  |1006| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |1007| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |1008| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |1009| 0  2  1 | 0  2  1 |
  |1010| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |1011| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |1012| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |1013| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |1014| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |1015| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |1016| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |1017| 0  2  1 | 0  2  1 |
  |1018| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |1019| 0  2  1 | 0  2  1 |
  |1020| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |1021| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |1022| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |1023| 0  2  1 | 0  2  1 |
  --------------------------

  Number of diffs: 4 (0.13%)

Change-Id: I65e89ac83418d0b6ee15b78a4d1e33ba7ba6d7d2

"}, {'created': '2018-02-14 23:57:13.000000000', 'message': "Add a basic partition diffing tool

A few weeks ago it was mentioned in channel that someone wished
they could compare builders to rings. So as a random lunch time
hack I created a partition diffing tool. I polished it up a bit
and thought it might be usful in the Swift tool box.

This patch adds a new tool, swift-partition-diff, which does
exactly what it says. It takes 2 builder or ring files
and does a comparasion on the _replica2parts2dev table and
will tell out how different they are.

  $ swift-partition-diff
  Usage: swift-partition-diff [--verbose] [--diffs] <builder1> <builder2>

  Options:
    -h, --help     show this help message and exit
    -v, --verbose  Print entire table
    -d, --diffs    Print only the diffs

In it's simplest form it takes in 2 builders or rings to compare:

  $ swift-partition-diff object.builder object.ring.gz
  Number of diffs: 0/3072 (0.00%)
  $ echo $?
  0

There are a few ways to read the output. Firstly is the return code,
where:

  0 - no differences
  1 - there are differences
  2+ - Errors running diff tool

Obviously the other way is to read the output. Number represents:

  Number of diffs: <number of replicath's different> (<percentage>%)

If you want more information, you can pass the `--diffs` (`-d`) to print
the partiions that have changed:

  $ swift-partition-diff object.builder object.ring.gz -d
  b1: object.builder
  b2: object.ring.gz

  --------------------------
  | P  |   b1    |   b2    |
  --------------------------
  --------------------------

  Number of diffs: 0/3072 (0.00%)

It obviously makes more sense on a ring that has changes, so lets take
one I've fiddled with:

  $ swift-partition-diff object.builder other-object.builder
  Number of diffs: 4/3072 (0.13%)

  $ swift-partition-diff object.builder other-object.builder -d
  b1: object.builder
  b2: other-object.builder

  --------------------------
  | P  |   b1    |   b2    |
  --------------------------
  |0015| 3  0 (2)| 3  0 (0)|
  |0150|(0) 2  1 |(5) 2  1 |
  |0550| 3 (0) 2 | 3 (2) 2 |
  |1005| 1  3 (0)| 1  3 (3)|
  --------------------------

  Number of diffs: 4/3072 (0.13%)

There is also a `--verbose` (`-v`) option, which will print the entire
_replica2part2dev table. It looks pretty, but is obviously very verbose:

  $ swift-partition-diff object.builder other-object.builder -v
  b1: object.builder
  b2: other-object.builder

  --------------------------
  | P  |   b1    |   b2    |
  --------------------------
  |0000| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0001| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |0002| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0003| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0004| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0005| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |0006| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0007| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0008| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0009| 0  2  1 | 0  2  1 |
  |0010| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |0011| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |0012| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |0013| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0014| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |0015| 3  0 (2)| 3  0 (0)|
  |0016| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |0017| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0018| 0  2  1 | 0  2  1 |
  |0019| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0020| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
    .    .  .  .   .  .  .
  |1005| 1  3 (0)| 1  3 (3)|
  |1006| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |1007| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |1008| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |1009| 0  2  1 | 0  2  1 |
  |1010| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |1011| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |1012| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |1013| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |1014| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |1015| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |1016| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |1017| 0  2  1 | 0  2  1 |
  |1018| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |1019| 0  2  1 | 0  2  1 |
  |1020| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |1021| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |1022| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |1023| 0  2  1 | 0  2  1 |
  --------------------------

  Number of diffs: 4/3072 (0.13%)

Change-Id: I65e89ac83418d0b6ee15b78a4d1e33ba7ba6d7d2

    -h, --help     show this help message and exit

    -d, --diffs    Print only the diffs

In it's simplest form it takes in 2 builders or rings to compare:

  $ swift-partition-diff object.builder other-object.builder -d

  b2: other-object.builder

  | P  |   b1    |   b2    |

  |0015| 3  0 (2)| 3  0 (0)|
  |0150|(0) 2  1 |(5) 2  1 |
  |0550| 3 (0) 2 | 3 (2) 2 |
  |1005| 1  3 (0)| 1  3 (3)|
  --------------------------

  Number of diffs: 4/3072 (0.13%)

There is also a `--verbose` (`-v`) option, which will print the entire
_replica2part2dev table. It looks pretty, but is obviously very verbose:

  $ swift-partition-diff object.builder other-object.builder -v
  b1: object.builder
  b2: other-object.builder

  --------------------------
  | P  |   b1    |   b2    |
  --------------------------
  |0000| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |

  |0006| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0007| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0008| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |

    .    .  .  .   .  .  .
  |1005| 1  3 (0)| 1  3 (3)|
  |1006| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |1007| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |1008| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |1009| 0  2  1 | 0  2  1 |
  |1010| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |

Because random on py2 and py3 behave differently when unit testing
this tool the ring randomisation is disabled. Which is why you'll

"}, {'created': '2022-04-22 02:07:53.000000000', 'message': "Add a basic partition diffing tool

A few weeks ago it was mentioned in channel that someone wished
they could compare builders to rings. So as a random lunch time
hack I created a partition diffing tool. I polished it up a bit
and thought it might be usful in the Swift tool box.

This patch adds a new tool, swift-partition-diff, which does
exactly what it says. It takes 2 builder or ring files
and does a comparasion on the _replica2parts2dev table and
will tell out how different they are.

  $ swift-partition-diff
  Usage: swift-partition-diff [--verbose] [--diffs] <builder1> <builder2>

  Options:
    -h, --help            show this help message and exit
    -v, --verbose         Print entire table
    -d, --diffs           Print only the diffs
    -g GREATER, --greater=GREATER
                          Only show diffs greater then this. Default 0

In it's simplest form it takes in 2 builders or rings to compare:

  $ swift-partition-diff object.builder object.ring.gz
  Number of diffs: 0/3072 (0.00%)
  $ echo $?
  0

There are a few ways to read the output. Firstly is the return code,
where:

  0 - no differences
  1 - there are differences
  2+ - Errors running diff tool

Obviously the other way is to read the output. Number represents:

  Number of diffs: <number of replicath's different> (<percentage>%)

If you want more information, you can pass the `--diffs` (`-d`) to print
the partiions that have changed:

  $ swift-partition-diff object.builder object.ring.gz -d
  b1: object.builder
  b2: object.ring.gz

  --------------------------
  | P  |   b1    |   b2    |
  --------------------------
  --------------------------

  Number of diffs: 0/3072 (0.00%)

It obviously makes more sense on a ring that has changes, so lets take
one I've fiddled with:

  $ swift-partition-diff object.builder other-object.builder
  Number of diffs: 4/3072 (0.13%)

  $ swift-partition-diff object.builder other-object.builder -d
  b1: object.builder
  b2: other-object.builder

  --------------------------
  | P  |   b1    |   b2    |
  --------------------------
  |0015| 3  0 (2)| 3  0 (0)|
  |0150|(0) 2  1 |(5) 2  1 |
  |0550| 3 (0) 2 | 3 (2) 2 |
  |1005| 1  3 (0)| 1  3 (3)|
  --------------------------

  Number of diffs: 4/3072 (0.13%)

There is also a `--verbose` (`-v`) option, which will print the entire
_replica2part2dev table. It looks pretty, but is obviously very verbose:

  $ swift-partition-diff object.builder other-object.builder -v
  b1: object.builder
  b2: other-object.builder

  --------------------------
  | P  |   b1    |   b2    |
  --------------------------
  |0000| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0001| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |0002| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |

  |0018| 0  2  1 | 0  2  1 |
  |0019| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0020| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
    .    .  .  .   .  .  .
  |1005| 1  3 (0)| 1  3 (3)|

  |1007| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |1008| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |

  |1012| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |1013| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |

  |1015| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |1016| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |1017| 0  2  1 | 0  2  1 |
  |1018| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |1019| 0  2  1 | 0  2  1 |
  |1020| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |1021| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |1022| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |1023| 0  2  1 | 0  2  1 |
  --------------------------

  Number of diffs: 4/3072 (0.13%)

Because random on py2 and py3 behave differently when unit testing
this tool the ring randomisation is disabled. Which is why you'll
see all devices in the rings in order when running the tests.

commit_message:
Add a basic partition diffing tool

A few weeks ago it was mentioned in channel that someone wished
they could compare builders to rings. So as a random lunch time
hack I created a partition diffing tool. I polished it up a bit
and thought it might be usful in the Swift tool box.

This patch adds a new tool, swift-partition-diff, which does
exactly what it says. It takes 2 builder or ring files
and does a comparasion on the _replica2parts2dev table and
will tell out how different they are.

  $ swift-partition-diff
  Usage: swift-partition-diff [--verbose] [--diffs] <builder1> <builder2>

  Options:
    -h, --help            show this help message and exit
    -v, --verbose         Print entire table
    -d, --diffs           Print only the diffs
    -g GREATER, --greater=GREATER
                          Only show diffs greater then this. Default 0

In it's simplest form it takes in 2 builders or rings to compare:

  $ swift-partition-diff object.builder object.ring.gz
  Number of diffs: 0/3072 (0.00%)
  $ echo $?
  0

There are a few ways to read the output. Firstly is the return code,
where:

  0 - no differences
  1 - there are differences
  2+ - Errors running diff tool

Obviously the other way is to read the output. Number represents:

  Number of diffs: <number of replicath's different> (<percentage>%)

If you want more information, you can pass the `--diffs` (`-d`) to print
the partiions that have changed:

  $ swift-partition-diff object.builder object.ring.gz -d
  b1: object.builder
  b2: object.ring.gz

  --------------------------
  | P  |   b1    |   b2    |
  --------------------------
  --------------------------

  Number of diffs: 0/3072 (0.00%)

It obviously makes more sense on a ring that has changes, so lets take
one I've fiddled with:

  $ swift-partition-diff object.builder other-object.builder
  Number of diffs: 4/3072 (0.13%)

  $ swift-partition-diff object.builder other-object.builder -d
  b1: object.builder
  b2: other-object.builder

  --------------------------
  | P  |   b1    |   b2    |
  --------------------------
  |0015| 3  0 (2)| 3  0 (0)|
  |0150|(0) 2  1 |(5) 2  1 |
  |0550| 3 (0) 2 | 3 (2) 2 |
  |1005| 1  3 (0)| 1  3 (3)|
  --------------------------

  Number of diffs: 4/3072 (0.13%)

There is also a `--verbose` (`-v`) option, which will print the entire
_replica2part2dev table. It looks pretty, but is obviously very verbose:

  $ swift-partition-diff object.builder other-object.builder -v
  b1: object.builder
  b2: other-object.builder

  --------------------------
  | P  |   b1    |   b2    |
  --------------------------
  |0000| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0001| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |0002| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0003| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0004| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0005| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |0006| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0007| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0008| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0009| 0  2  1 | 0  2  1 |
  |0010| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |0011| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |0012| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |0013| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0014| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |0015| 3  0 (2)| 3  0 (0)|
  |0016| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |0017| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0018| 0  2  1 | 0  2  1 |
  |0019| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |0020| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
    .    .  .  .   .  .  .
  |1005| 1  3 (0)| 1  3 (3)|
  |1006| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |1007| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |1008| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |1009| 0  2  1 | 0  2  1 |
  |1010| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |1011| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |1012| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |1013| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |1014| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |1015| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |1016| 1  3  0 | 1  3  0 |
  |1017| 0  2  1 | 0  2  1 |
  |1018| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |1019| 0  2  1 | 0  2  1 |
  |1020| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |1021| 2  1  3 | 2  1  3 |
  |1022| 3  0  2 | 3  0  2 |
  |1023| 0  2  1 | 0  2  1 |
  --------------------------

  Number of diffs: 4/3072 (0.13%)

Because random on py2 and py3 behave differently when unit testing
this tool the ring randomisation is disabled. Which is why you'll
see all devices in the rings in order when running the tests.

Change-Id: I65e89ac83418d0b6ee15b78a4d1e33ba7ba6d7d2

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-19 14:56:18.000000000', 'message': "Manila: Remove unnecessary 'undef'

Hiera expects a default value when it doesn't find anything matching the key.
But the hiera function is called with two default values for
dellemc_unity::emc_share_backend

This change removes the unnecessary undef parameter.

Change-Id: Ia59a79fbd293775afdacd9f8a517ff256720a7c0
"}, {'created': '2022-04-21 01:14:48.000000000', 'message': "Manila: Remove unnecessary 'undef'

The third argument of the hiera function determines merge behavior.
This is currently used for dellemc_unity::emc_share_backend only and is
not used in the other places. In addition passing undef has no effect
so it is just redundant.

This change removes the unnecessary undef parameter, to make usage of
the hiera function consistent across all manifests.

Change-Id: Ia59a79fbd293775afdacd9f8a517ff256720a7c0
"}, {'created': '2022-04-21 01:17:09.000000000', 'message': "Manila: Remove unnecessary 'undef'

The third argument of the hiera function determines the hierarchy level
to insert at the top of the hierarchy[1].
 [1] https://puppet.com/docs/puppet/7/function.html#hiera

This is currently used for dellemc_unity::emc_share_backend only and is
not used in the other places. In addition passing undef has no effect
so it is just redundant.

This change removes the unnecessary undef parameter, to make usage of
the hiera function consistent across all manifests.

Change-Id: Ia59a79fbd293775afdacd9f8a517ff256720a7c0
"}]
commit_message:
Manila: Remove unnecessary 'undef'

The third argument of the hiera function determines the hierarchy level
to insert at the top of the hierarchy[1].
 [1] https://puppet.com/docs/puppet/7/function.html#hiera

This is currently used for dellemc_unity::emc_share_backend only and is
not used in the other places. In addition passing undef has no effect
so it is just redundant.

This change removes the unnecessary undef parameter, to make usage of
the hiera function consistent across all manifests.

Change-Id: Ia59a79fbd293775afdacd9f8a517ff256720a7c0

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-19 11:01:14.000000000', 'message': 'Glance: Replace hiera by lookup

The hiera function is deprecated and does not work with the latest
hieradata version 5. It should be replaced by the new lookup
function[1].

[1] https://puppet.com/docs/puppet/7/hiera_automatic.html

With the lookup function, we can define value type and merge behavior,
but these are kept default at this moment to limit scope of this change
to just simple replacement. Adding value type might be useful to make
sure the value is in expected type (especially when a boolean value is
expected), but we will revisit that later.

example:
lookup(<NAME>, [<VALUE TYPE>], [<MERGE BEHAVIOR>], [<DEFAULT VALUE>])

Change-Id: I1e2dcec22f74e47a48d6f29b177c14cd2b41a666

commit_message:
Glance: Replace hiera by lookup

The hiera function is deprecated and does not work with the latest
hieradata version 5. It should be replaced by the new lookup
function[1].

[1] https://puppet.com/docs/puppet/7/hiera_automatic.html

With the lookup function, we can define value type and merge behavior,
but these are kept default at this moment to limit scope of this change
to just simple replacement. Adding value type might be useful to make
sure the value is in expected type (especially when a boolean value is
expected), but we will revisit that later.

example:
lookup(<NAME>, [<VALUE TYPE>], [<MERGE BEHAVIOR>], [<DEFAULT VALUE>])

Change-Id: I1e2dcec22f74e47a48d6f29b177c14cd2b41a666

commit_message:
Reject bad img formats for uploaded encrypted vols

Cinder only supports uploading volumes of encrypted volume types as
images with disk format 'raw' and container format 'bare'.  Screen
for this at the REST API layer when the request is made.

This change is applied directly to the VolumeActionsController in
the cinder.api.contrib module, so it affects both the Block Storage
API v2 and v3.

Change-Id: Ibb77b8b1be6c35c5db3b07fdc4056afd51d48782
Closes-bug: #1935688
(cherry picked from commit de8b3b0b00421a01ed777880d2b5bf6fffc068d5)
(cherry picked from commit 78682022d2dcf07c270356d23a27843578466469)
(cherry picked from commit 12f7376fe44ea53e6e84dfd12577953bd841d25d)
(cherry picked from commit fac676112da484e8ad2627de4333ab72b70fe5c8)
(cherry picked from commit 7c3f7379feb41664c3881de99b54ca13a6b8ec61)

[{'created': '2022-01-21 03:13:45.000000000', 'message': 'Cap cinder-tempest-plugin version for stable/train

We are capping stable/train testing with Tempest
26.1.0 (choosing 26.1.0 because of bug#1955418)
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/822339

To have compatible cinder-tempest-plugin version for
Tempest 26.1.0 and stable/train testing, we need to cap
it with 1.3.0.

Change-Id: I6378c644fada27b6945c7953ccfd78e24e62071c
'}]
commit_message:
Cap cinder-tempest-plugin version for stable/train

We are capping stable/train testing with Tempest
26.1.0 (choosing 26.1.0 because of bug#1955418)
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/822339

To have compatible cinder-tempest-plugin version for
Tempest 26.1.0 and stable/train testing, we need to cap
it with 1.3.0.

Change-Id: I6378c644fada27b6945c7953ccfd78e24e62071c

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-19 09:13:54.000000000', 'message': 'Cinder: Replace hiera by lookup

The hiera function is deprecated and does not work with the latest
hieradata version 5. It should be replaced by the new lookup
function[1].

[1] https://puppet.com/docs/puppet/7/hiera_automatic.html

With the lookup function, we can define value type and merge behavior,
but these are kept default at this moment to limit scope of this change
to just simple replacement. Adding value type might be useful to make
sure the value is in expected type (especially when a boolean value is
expected), but we will revisit that later.

example:
lookup(<NAME>, [<VALUE TYPE>], [<MERGE BEHAVIOR>], [<DEFAULT VALUE>])

Change-Id: I77cb622a7ec1471715bb3e4fcb0157e5a6b80e74

commit_message:
Cinder: Replace hiera by lookup

The hiera function is deprecated and does not work with the latest
hieradata version 5. It should be replaced by the new lookup
function[1].

[1] https://puppet.com/docs/puppet/7/hiera_automatic.html

With the lookup function, we can define value type and merge behavior,
but these are kept default at this moment to limit scope of this change
to just simple replacement. Adding value type might be useful to make
sure the value is in expected type (especially when a boolean value is
expected), but we will revisit that later.

example:
lookup(<NAME>, [<VALUE TYPE>], [<MERGE BEHAVIOR>], [<DEFAULT VALUE>])

Change-Id: I77cb622a7ec1471715bb3e4fcb0157e5a6b80e74
